DescriptionText.Text: For shotguns.
Incendiary ammo for compatible shotguns.
For grenade launchers. Obviously.
Small-caliber rounds for pistols, revolvers and rifles.
Small-caliber rounds for pistols, revolvers, rifles, and SMGs.
Powerful round for revolvers and some rifles.
Mid-range round for pistols and some submachineguns.
Powerful round primarily for revolvers and some rifles.
Powerful mid-range workhorse for pistols, some revolvers and rifles.
Very powerful round for large frame revolvers, pistols and long range rifles.
Standard NATO battle rifle caliber, includes the .223 caliber family of rounds as well.
Powerful round used the world over. Includes the entirety of the thirty-caliber family of rifle ammunition. Used by battle rifles and long-range rifles.
Traveling light is good, but having what you need is better.
Traveling light is good, but having what you need is better.
Traveling light is good, but having what you need is better.
Traveling light is good, but having what you need is better.

More carrying capacity, but it's bulky.
More carrying capacity, but it's bulky.
More carrying capacity, but it's bulky.
More carrying capacity, but it's bulky.
More carrying capacity, but it's bulky.
More carrying capacity, but it's bulky.
More carrying capacity, but it's bulky.
More carrying capacity, but it's bulky.
More carrying capacity, but it's bulky.
A low-slung bag for the efficient packer.
You can't start off a new school year without a sweet-ass new backpack!
Numbs the pain, but won't help serious wounds.
Numbs the pain, but won't help serious wounds. Typical over-the-counter stuff.
Numbs the pain, but won't help serious wounds. Typical over-the-counter stuff. Come on, everybody knows what aspirin is.
Numbs the pain, but won't help serious wounds. Typical over-the-counter stuff. I like the ones with the sugary coating.
Numbs the pain, but won't help serious wounds. Serious stuff. Feels pretty damn good, though.
Numbs the pain, but won't help serious wounds. Typical over-the-counter stuff. Tastes like ass, but knocks out just about anything.
Numbs the pain, but won't help serious wounds. Serious stuff. Also good for getting off the junk.
Serious stuff. Numbs the pain, but won't help serious wounds. It'll just make you not care about them.
Good stuff. Numbs the pain, but won't help serious wounds.
Eat for a temporary stamina boost.
So good...
Restores max stamina a little. It's cold, it's stale, and I think it was filtered with zombie guts, but dammit, it's coffee.
Mmmm, guarana. (Removes penalties to your maximum stamina)
Restores max Stamina a little. Fresh from our med lab. Heisenberg would be proud.
Restores max Stamina a lot. Fresh from our lab, cooked up extra potent. (Addictive?)
Restores max stamina a fair bit. (Addictive?) Pure glass--the good stuff. Accept no substitute.
Restores max stamina a fair bit. (Addictive?) King of the Road Trucking Pills. Truck as hard as you want. The label says fenethyl-something, only approved in Europe.
Restores max stamina a fair bit. (Addictive?) Active ingredient: modafinil. Whatever that is.
Sets zeds on fire. This one's just a rag stuffed into a bottle of booze. Top shelf too.
Sets zeds on fire. They don't seem to like it much. This one's made with gasoline.
Light em' up! Redneck's special blend. Pretty sure it's pure wood-grain alcohol.
Zeds dislike fire. This one comes fresh out of our workshop, so go us!
Sets zeds on fire. They don't seem to like it much. Watch it with this one--it's got a kick.
The AN-M14 TH3 chemical incendiary. Pretty sure this one could melt through a truck engine.
Pull pin, toss, wait for boom. Repeat as necessary.
You throw it. It goes boom. If you're lucky, not right in your face.
Standard military hand grenade. This one fell off a truck, a big green truck.
The old pineapple grenade, I'm sure it's still ok after sitting around for 65 years.
It's a bunch of explosives stuffed into a pipe. What could go wrong?
It's a WHOLE bunch of explosives stuffed into a pipe. Extra shrapnel means more dead zombies.
Lights an area up. Good for night-time zombie spotting, or night-time zombie luring.
So what if it's a bunch of nuts and bolts in an old paint can? It still explodes.
Like a Molotov, but this one's pressure sensitive.
Cram a noisemaker into an improvised mine, and it lures the zombies in before it explodes. Nice.
Pops up to head height for optimal zombie killing.
Stockpiled since 1974, this example came out of an EOD training container.
Toss this to target an area for artillery.
Sudden noises are great for grabbing attention. (Best to toss these and then run or hide.)
Even dead, people still hate this sound. Brings the zombies running.
Set the timer and run like hell. Zombies'll come running like it's Sunday dinner.
This one's just plain creepy. Seems to attract the zombies, though.
Cuts down gunshot noise. Made this one out of an oil can, figure it's only good for 10 shots or so.
Cuts down gunshot noise. Decent construction; this one should last 30 shots, give or take.
Cuts down gunshot noise. Not quite professional quality, but might last for a good 50 shots.
What a piece of crap. Guess I could use it to break a window.

NoteText.Text: I never meant to... hell, I never thought I was even capable of something like that. I guess you never really know what you're capable of until you're three days out from your last meal and some kid grabs the last can of tuna fish out from under you, huh? Learned a lot of things that day. Like how it feels to crush the life out of somebody's throat. I don't even know who I'm writing this note to. God? Myself? That kid? Hell, whoever you are, I'm sorry.

DescriptionText.Text: Hasty scribblings in pencil on the back of an office envelope.

NoteText.Text: Day 9. The attacks are getting more frequent now. They know we're here. Ammo's running low, but it's the stress that's really getting to us. Can't sleep with all those screamers out there. Vasquez is taking it the worst--if you find this note, and you find us dead from gunshot wounds, look at Vasquez.

DescriptionText.Text: Black pen on a yellow legal notepad, there is a bloody thumbprint in the corner.

NoteText.Text: Never realized how much food three people can go through in a week. When we found that Tartan Mart nobody had hit yet, we thought we'd taken enough for a month, but now it's a week later and the food's all gone and that Tartan Mart has been totally picked over... and now I don't know what to do.

DescriptionText.Text: Blue ballpoint pen on the back of a Tartan Mart inventory order form.

NoteText.Text: I'm leaving this note for my family and friends. If that's not you, put this note down before the poison in the ink seeps into your skin and kills you. If it is you, don't worry, the poison thing was a bluff. I'm going across the river to find out what those Army pigs know. If I'm not back by Thursday, assume I've been compromised by government mind-lasers and you should shoot me on sight.

DescriptionText.Text: Black felt-tip pen on a cardboard box top.

NoteText.Text: This note is for John. And for Sara. It's for Lisa and Geraldo and Mahz and all of them. I'm the only one left. Guys, I'm sorry this is the best memorial I can give you. I'm gonna leave this note someplace I hope people will find it. I'm gonna leave it with some pictures from that Vegas weekend last year. Hopefully it finds its way to your people. Love all you guys.

DescriptionText.Text: Blue ballpoint pen on pink flowery stationery, sealed in a plastic sandwich bag.

NoteText.Text: Dear Anthony, We waited as long as we could. Your father isn't willing to stay any longer. I suppose he's right. We can't risk everyone else. I hope you find this note and that you come find us. We didn't want to leave without you. We love you. Be safe.

DescriptionText.Text: Red pen in an envelope with the name, "Anthony" on the front.

NoteText.Text: Carly, if you get this note, STAY HERE. I heard a rumor you were in Danforth, so I went to check it out, but just in case it's wrong, I want you to wait for me here. Lock the doors, there's food and ammo in the house, and don't let anyone in who isn't me. Okay? I'll see you soon.

DescriptionText.Text: Black pen on a yellow sticky-note.

NoteText.Text: Dear Colin, I'm leaving you. I can't take the lies, or the paranoia, or the constant harping about government conspiracy. I'm going to stay with my mother up north. Don't try to find me. - Elsa. P.S. I took all your guns, your ammo, and your ridiculous MREs and I threw them in the river. Serves you right, you pig.

DescriptionText.Text: Blue pen on crumpled notepaper.

NoteText.Text: Dear Diary, HOLY SHIT IT WORKED! When Skyler said he found a ritual that could bend the dead to our black wills and finally take revenge on assholes like Ricky Valdez I kinda thought he was full of shit, but IT WORKED! It's all over the news, the dead are rising from the grave to eat the flesh of the living! BRB, I'm going to try out my sweet zombie-controlling powers!

DescriptionText.Text: Red ballpoint in a small, leather bound diary.

NoteText.Text: Dear whatever prick came in here to loot my house: one can of food in this kitchen is poisoned. Good luck, asshole.

DescriptionText.Text: Red felt-tip pen on construction paper, large lettering.

NoteText.Text: Project: PALLAS Phase 1 complete. Evaluation: Vastly exceeded expected parameters. Phase 2 pending reestablishment of proper chain of command.

DescriptionText.Text: Black pen on a military form 469, labeled "Duty Limiting Condition Report". Signed by Lt Col Schwalier.

NoteText.Text: If you think this thing "just happened," you're fooling yourself. Someone knows what caused this, someone is BEHIND this. Don't believe me? Then riddle me this: why did the Army start ferrying people in two days BEFORE the first confirmed attacks?

DescriptionText.Text: Typewriter (yes, an actual typewriter) on typing paper.

NoteText.Text: Weird stuff on the news, and today Job Wilkerson pays me a call and says I can pay him off in bullets and food instead of cash. What the hell's going on?

DescriptionText.Text: Blue felt-tip pen on white notepad. Three extra question marks.

NoteText.Text: Aunt Helen: Took me ten years, but I finally found it. Proof that the sheriff buried evidence in my cousin's case so he and that damned judge could keep their conviction rate intact. I was supposed to show it to Councilman Santos' friend at the Marshall Gazette today, but he had to reschedule. Something about a major story breaking at the hospital.

DescriptionText.Text: Computer printout on personal letterhead, mailed two weeks ago.

NoteText.Text: Strain 854b shows a remarkable resistance to traditional antibiotic countermeasures. Estimated probability of successful containment: 13.48%

DescriptionText.Text: Black pen on a heavily redacted CDC NORS (WDT) form.

NoteText.Text: I've waited my whole life for this moment. My katana is sharp, my .50 caliber is fully loaded, and my trench coat is freshly dry-cleaned. Time to kill some zombies.

DescriptionText.Text: White paint pen on black construction paper.

NoteText.Text: MISSING GIRL: Have you seen me? Alex Collins, 5'6" 113 lbs., brown eyes, purple-dyed hair. REWARD OFFERED, NO QUESTIONS ASKED. We just want our little girl home.

DescriptionText.Text: Color photocopy, with several pictures.

NoteText.Text: Harlan, can you pick up a carton of milk at the Tartan Mart next time you're out? I want to bake a cake for Lucy's birthday. Thanks! - Sandy xoxoxo

DescriptionText.Text: Blue pen on a sticky note that reads, "To do list".

NoteText.Text: Hi Ma. Dunno why I keep writing these notes to you--I'm a little too old to believe you're reading them up in Heaven. Habit, I guess. Well, anyways, Joanie had the baby, but it was a pretty tough labor. She's staying with her folks out west for a little while, but I've got to stay here and keep working. It's hard, knowing she and little Max are so far away, but that's what men do for their families, right? That's what you and dad taught me, anyway. Okay, Ma, I gotta go--something's on the TV about an emergency evacuation order or something. I better go see what it is. Love to Grandma and Grandpa. - Eugene

DescriptionText.Text: Blue ballpoint pen in a small, well-worn notebook.

NoteText.Text: Kate - Your dad's still not back from the commissary at the ranger station. I'm going to go see what's keeping him. If I'm not back before you wake up, stay in the cabin and have a granola bar for breakfast. No using the camp stove unsupervised. - Mom

DescriptionText.Text: Black pen on the back of a granola bar box.

NoteText.Text: This cell phone has a cracked screen and almost no battery life left, but the camera function shows a series of images of shambling figures lurking into the light of a campfire while some college kids look on. The last image shows one of the figures grabbing a young man by the shoulders. The call log shows seven dropped calls to 911.

DescriptionText.Text: Damaged cellphone, stuck on the "My Photos" folder.

NoteText.Text: Saw some creepy dude hanging out by the public restrooms. He looked drunk. Maybe stoned. Stank too. Gross. I decided to hold it.

DescriptionText.Text: Silver felt-tip pen, cursive, on cream-colored diary paper, the "O" in gross has a smiley face in it.

NoteText.Text: Ranger Gunderson - We apologize, but despite your repeated requests we cannot authorize the purchase of any .50 caliber hunting rifles for the ranger station. We would like to remind you that bears have not been seen on Mt. Tanner in over forty years, and moreover large-caliber rifles are not a recommended means of dealing with rogue bears.

DescriptionText.Text: Compter printout on official County Parks Administration letterhead.

Toss this to target an area for mortar.

Civilian version of the M4.
Paratrooper version of the AK frame.
An AR15 with some new furniture.
Legendary battle rifle.
Short-stroke piston reliability. Scoped.
A versatile, multi-role rifle in the field.
Customized with aftermarket additions, scoped.
50+ years of combat ops and counting.
USMC issue rifle. Badass attitude included.
The standard U.S. military rifle.
Short Barreled Rifle.
CQB - Close Quarters Battle.
An iconic Austrian bullpup design.
A classic scoped hunting rifle.
Has that classic cowboy flavor.
One of the most popular .22 cal. rifles.
Composite stock and iron sights.
Small game scope included at no charge!
When hunting big game, bring enough rifle.
Durable with reliable bolt action.
Rugged exterior, measured precision.
A favorite in north-central Florida.
Stood the test of a world war, highly collectible.
Fires the .50 BMG. For anti-materiel missions.
1980's TV made this very recognizable.
One version of the ever-evolving M14.
Pre-1964 models are very valuable. Scoped.
A classic western rifle. (replica)
The AK 47's older sister. Bayonet removed.
Long range service provider. Scoped.
Produced in the millions from 1891 to 1965.
Short pump, not legal. Don't try this at home.
Standard police shotgun in Trumbull County.
The best selling shotgun in history.
Popular autoloader. Loved by shooting enthusiasts.
Cut down version of the 1100.
Model 1100 for police and military use.
Standard pump action hunting Shotgun.
A pump shotgun says "Private Property".
Camouflaged pump hunting shotgun.
Evolutionary step in pump action shotguns.
A reliable military shotgun.
Tactical version of the 870.
Upgraded police shotgun.
An AK 47 and a shotgun had a baby.
Civilian version. Popular in video games.
Low profile, slim but brutal.
A workhorse for 20 years. Close to retirement.
The new kid on the block.
A lighter variant of the venerable heavy hitter.
Crowd dispersal in a 40mm package.
Essentially a 40mm revolver.
A battle rifle for the next generation, using the 7.62mm round.
Nicknamed "The right arm of the Free World".
British Armed Forces' standard issue since 1987.
An aggressive bullpup carbine, perfect for CQB.
Modular and versatile, this rifle enjoys worldwide popularity.
Small-caliber version of the famous spy's gun.
This .380 ACP firearm has been modified for 9mm.
A 5.7mm conversion to .22 caliber. Still very lethal to zombies.
Always a favorite in the 9mm class.
Full frame, using the .357 Sig round.
Compact, scoped "G" line that fires the .357 Sig round.
Sub-compact using .357 Sig caliber.
Special edition P226 with custom finish, uses the .357 Sig round.
A commercial failure made famous in the movies.
P229 beavertail in .40 cal.
Now in minty fresh .45 caliber! Thumb safety included!
Russian light support weapon, based on the AK chassis.
Light support weapon with serious combat history.
A very popular modern small frame .357 revolver.
Long barrel custom revolver using the .500 S&W round.
Historic Commonwealth sevice revolver, inscribed "Lt. Pears".
A custom M107 created to avenge Eli Wilkerson.
A scoped revolver-rifle hybrid in .45 caliber.
Made for Police to use the same .40 cal round as a sidearm.
.22 caliber "cadet" training version of the L85 rifles.
A British Army mainstay for most of the last century.
Very rugged, reliable lever action chambered in .357 caliber.
Turkish competitor to the Mod SG.
Rugged, special-purpose shotgun with a heat shield.
Modern replica of a western double barrel shotgun.
Severely shortened double barrel shotgun. Illegal everywhere.
Heavily customized, drum fed, nicknamed "Bonesaw".
The "Trench Gun" or M97. Still fires, but showing some wear.
Pimp my UMP! Camo paint, front post and an optic added.
Inexpensive, full auto only WWII SMG.
Civilian legal carbine in .357 (Sig) caliber.
Very reliable with RDSS sight system.
Tactical police rifle made in Switzerland.
Russian reliability that chambers NATO rounds.
A popular battle rifle worldwide for over 50 years.
The "C" stands for "Compact", the shorter brother to the G36.
Based on the AK design, this is a battle tested and reliable weapon.
Very short rifle, good for indoors but can be hard to tame.
The CS has a longer barrel for stability and scope.
A new bullpup battle rifle, fitted with an optic for high visibility at range.
New bullpup from Israel. Compact, accurate and reliable.
Designed and built in Czechoslovakia until the mid 1980s.
This next-generation rifle has an integrated optics package.
A lightweight, polymer .45 caliber pistol made for the civilian market.
A military and police oriented version of the F45, match barrel and optic.
Light weight polymer, accurate and reliable. Enough said.
Groomed for combat and comes with a threaded barrel.
An accurate and iconic collector's firearm. Be sure to keep it clean!
A special collector's item. Captured in WW II by a special G.I.
9mm revolvers made in the US are rare, now you have one!
Factory tacti-cool .22 varmint gun, with optic. In case the squirrels attack!
A venerable combat rifle used by the US military over a period of 70 years.
Pinpoint accuracy at long range, this rifle is a huge success in military units.
A veteran of many wars, this rifle can be found all over the world.
The pinnacle of precision M14 evolution to date. this version is custom to the Red Talon group.
The M110 Semi-Automatic Sniper System, due to replace the M24 system.
A brand new bullpup rifle with a unique forward ejection system. Stock sights.
A new, innovative bullpup. This one includes a suite of optics.
A folding, semi-auto survival rifle. Accurate but not meant for heavy use.
A long-time Cold Warrior, this rifle was often used in a sniper role. Sadly, this one has no scope.
All T21 rifles are made to easily convert between 9mm and 5.56mm.
This 870 is a tsunami of aftermarket parts by Schmidt Tactical. Inscribed with the word "Odin".
The long barrel on this 870 and custom parts make this a very accurate shotgun. Inscribed, "Gungnir".
Designed by the incredible J. Browning, this innovative lever action shotgun is a work of art.
Modern manufacture of the classic 1887, made popular by movies and video games.
This modern firearm is the spiritual successor to the great Czech gun engineers.
A full-auto version of the G17 with a high capacity magazine, classified as an SMG.
Familiar pistol silhouette of the 92 series produced as a full-auto SMG.
Full-auto paired with the usual Bz 75 excellence. Spare mag is fitted as a foregrip.
Technically a pistol, firing a rifle round, classified as an SMG. Did you get all that? Optic added.
The Swiss are still finding a niche for new SMGs with their latest offering. Optic included.
Experimental close assault weapon from CLEO.
Very reliable with RDSS sight system.
Customized with aftermarket additions, scoped.

From Russia with...great regard.

Found next to action figures. Replica.
Standard issue police baton.
Sturdy root chopper, good on zombies too.
Keep your apolcalypse garden trim!
A great tool for apocalypse gardening.
Flimsy sword from a late-night commercial show.

An entry level collector's sword.
Quality movie prop replica.
Heavy, sturdy and all business.
Time to channel your inner woodsman.
Roofing tool, very tough.
Dig it!
A must-have when gardening near zombies.
No apocalypse is complete without one.
The apocalyptic handyman's best friend.
Heavy, reliable, durable.
A ruthless zombie killing tool.
um, duh!
Also known as a headhunting axe.
A high quality antique reproduction from the late 1800's.
Giant wrench, made by the Big Ass Wrench Company, McMillanville. USA.
"One Axe to rule them all" - Dwarf Lordz
Nicknamed the "Hammer of Justice"
A wood and iron club weapon from feudal Japan. (replica)
Useful for both healing and dealing damage.
"...upon the sign the challengers, with shrieks and cries rush forth" - JP
Keeps weeds at bay, named "Barbra".
An inexpensive canoe oar.
High quality hardwood oar.
Broken hedge shears made a strong improvised blade.
Still effective at taking off limbs, zombie limbs.
Created from an industrial cutting tool. Very sturdy.
Improvised. Does not hold an edge well.

High quality antique, they don't make them like this anymore.
Good for more than rolling a pie crust.
These leave an impression.
Works equally well on zombies and cod.

Heavy, sturdy and all business.
For splitting wood and zed heads.
Extreme sports, indeed!
Well, you use what you can...

Swing from the hips!
Pump you up!

Helps firefighters gain some leverage.
Fight fire with steel.
A handy demolition tool.
Knock down burning stuff.
A heavy access tool.
I'm gonna wreck it!
Dig into some Zombie skulls.

A replica of the famous Ulfberht swords.
A requirement for any Day-Walker.
